snippet: The Washington metropolitan area is in line to experience the largest economic hit of any region from the $85 billion in spending cuts that President Obama made official on Friday.
abstract: People in Northern Virginia are in line to experience a big economic hit from the $85 billion in automatic spending cuts known as sequestration; many of the 90,000 civilian Defense Dept employees who live in the area will lose 20 percent of their salaries; ripple effect, as those employees pare expenses and put off big purchases, is expected to be large and some economists predict the state will fall into recession.
lead_paragraph: The Washington metropolitan area is in line to experience the largest economic hit of any region from the $85 billion in spending cuts that President Obama made official on Friday.

headline.main: Virginia’s Feast on U.S. Funds Nears an End
headline.print_headline: Virginia’s Feast On U.S. Funds Nears an End

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
